file_content.text: House Thul grows stronger every day. Your efforts proved invaluable.
Sensors detect readings from the facility. The droid factory's back in Thul's control!
House Thul will flourish with our supply of droids replenished. Soon, no one will oppose us.
Thank goodness! I've been requesting backup all day, but my blasted comm unit's malfunctioning!
At least I'm not completely cursed. You lot look like all the luck I could ever hope for.
No matter. You're better than an army of reinforcements, my lord. Just what I require.
At least you've arrived, agent. This operation demands as much precision as force.
Your presence here could benefit us both. Nothing turns a profit like war.
Typical. Nothing ever works when you've got a catastrophe on your hands.
My mission was to wrest the droid factory from Ulgo's grip, but my men were ambushed and killed. I need the job finished.
What's so important about this facility?
Why fight over a factory?
You can't finish it?
I'm a strategist, not a combat expert. We can't afford another loss here.
I'm not cleaning up after your failure.
Don't involve me in your mess.
There was no way we could've predicted Ulgo's ambush.
That factory belongs to House Thul! Its droids were made by the Empire to defend and rebuild our crumbling fortresses.
Since Ulgo stole the facility, our progress has ground to a halt. There's only one way to fix this.
I have complete faith in your abilities.
Don't worry. House Thul takes care of its friends.
Spend more time on Alderaan. You'll soon appreciate the need for Ulgo's defeat.
I won't rest until Ulgo's men are in the ground.
Uh...I'm Miles. Got a plan to take back the factory, with your help. Won't need an army, just these dataspikes.
Insert 'em into the factory terminals, and I can remotely shut the whole place down. If Ulgo don't stop you.
I'll get past them.
If the price is right.
Here's the dataspikes. I'll contact you once we're ready for the switch. Good luck.
Not worth it. [Refuse quest]
